intro: Racosperma baxteri, commonly known as the Baxter's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellow flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. Racosperma baxteri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
